text.text_translated:
Terrie Sharp is a writer. Her books are very popular. She tells good stories. She won a prize two times. It was the Olive Crime Writer Award.

She was born in Glasgow. She lived in an area of houses. Many bad things happened there. She learned to be quiet. She learned to stay out of problems. She learned to open car doors with a knife.

But she did this only for her books. Now she is not quiet. She is on TV shows like Police Today. She goes to writer meetings. She goes to meetings in all parts of the UK.

feedback.feedback: PASS: All diagnostic checks passed. The text accurately reflects the original content without factual errors. MeaningBERT score of 0.7827 and BERTScore of 0.906 both meet the required thresholds, indicating excellent preservation of meaning and lexical fidelity. The CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2. The vocabulary is appropriate for A2, with B1 words 'sharp' and 'olive' correctly used as proper nouns. Sentence structures are consistently short and simple, using only basic connectors like 'but', which is ideal for the A2 level.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Terrie Sharp is a writer. Her books are very popular. She tells good stories. She won a prize two times. It was the Olive Crime Writer Award.

She was born in Glasgow. She lived in an area of houses. Many bad things happened there. She learned to be quiet. She learned to stay out of problems. She learned to open car doors with a knife.

But she did this only for her books. Now she is not quiet. She is on TV shows like Police Today. She goes to writer meetings. She goes to meetings in all parts of the UK.
